description-cards.title: Your Turn: Blank Circle

description-cards.title: Example: Circle Divided into Thirds
description-cards.description:
White circle divided into 3 equal parts:

‚Ä¢ Three lines from center to edge
‚Ä¢ Each line exactly 120¬∞ apart
‚Ä¢ Line 1: Straight up (12 o'clock)
‚Ä¢ Line 2: Points to 4 o'clock
‚Ä¢ Line 3: Points to 8 o'clock

‚Ä¢ Center dot shows where lines meet
‚Ä¢ Light mint tint on 2 sections (for clarity)
‚Ä¢ All three sections are EXACTLY equal

You could rotate this circle 120¬∞ and it would look the same!
description-cards.math_question: How do you know these parts are equal?

description-cards.title: Example: Rectangle Divided into Fourths

description-cards.math_question: If each piece is 80px, how wide is the whole sandwich?

description-cards.title: Assessment: Which Show Equal Parts?
description-cards.description:
Three shapes to compare:

Shape A (rectangle):
‚Ä¢ Divided into 4 vertical sections
‚Ä¢ Each section: 45px wide
‚Ä¢ All perfectly equal!

Shape B (rectangle):
‚Ä¢ Divided into 4 vertical sections
‚Ä¢ Widths: 25px, 70px, 50px, 35px
‚Ä¢ Clearly unequal!

Shape C (circle):
‚Ä¢ Divided into 3 sections from center
‚Ä¢ Each section: exactly 120¬∞
‚Ä¢ All perfectly equal!
description-cards.math_question: Which shapes show equal parts: A, B, or C?

description-cards.title: Connecting 1/3 to the Visual
description-cards.description:
Left side: Circle divided into 3 equal parts
‚Ä¢ One section shaded mint green
‚Ä¢ Two sections white
‚Ä¢ All three parts equal (120¬∞ each)

Right side: The fraction 1/3
‚Ä¢ Top number (1) = parts we have (shaded)
‚Ä¢ Bottom number (3) = total equal parts

The shaded section is ONE out of THREE equal parts = 1/3
description-cards.math_question: What does the top number tell us? What does the bottom number tell us?

description-cards.title: Is This Correct? ü§î
description-cards.description:
Rectangle divided into 4 parts and labeled "1/4":

BUT WAIT...
‚Ä¢ Section 1: 45px wide
‚Ä¢ Section 2: 105px wide (more than TWICE as big!)
‚Ä¢ Section 3: 85px wide  
‚Ä¢ Section 4: 65px wide

First section is shaded coral red (to draw attention)
description-cards.math_question: Can we really call this 1/4? Why or why not?

description-cards.title: Hint: How to Make Halves

description-cards.math_question: Where would you draw a line to split this in half?
